ngiemboon: Púʼu la, páʼ Ssé la lɔg pɔ́ tsɔ́ɔnmezìŋe yé, ńnáa yɔɔn fàʼ mbwó peg la, peg te kʉ́a wɔ́.
en: Therefore, since we have this ministry because we were shown mercy,   we do not give up.  # 4:1 2Th 3:13

ngiemboon: Peg te na mentí lɔg faʼa fàʼ mie ée me ntsem, ńgíŋ ńgwɔ́ me shʉ́ wɔ́, atsɔ̌ nkÿonkÿo te na kwò legìŋ yég wɔ́, peg piŋ ńké te ne ńdɔgɔ tsɔ́ menò ḿvoŋo shwóŋè Ssé wɔ́, tà ńcʉ́ʼ púʼu, peg lɔg páʼ peg ee mvfò Ssé, ńdaʼte pɔ́ nò nénʉ́ mbwó pʉ̀a mesoŋ, tà ngwɔ́ gie à lɔɔn ngwɔ́ nyìŋ le laʼa wég na tsɔ́ nò wɔ́.
en: Instead, we have renounced secret and shameful things, not acting   deceitfully or distorting the word of God,  # 4:2 2Co 2:17; 2Tm 2:15; Heb 4:12 but commending ourselves before God to everyone’s conscience by an open display of the truth.  # 4:2 2Co 5:11–12; 6:7; 7:14

ngiemboon: Á lɔɔn ḿbiŋ ńgwɔ́ gie nkʉ̀ mbòŋo gẅie peg tsẅii, ée mbwó tsɔ́ pʉ̀a ńnyé pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ nkùɔ, mbà nkùɔ pwoon púʼu, pɔ́ mbwó pʉ̀a pie é ne ńkÿo Ssé ńgee ḿbyé pyě,
en: But if our gospel is veiled, it is veiled to those who are perishing.

ngiemboon: ée pajúʼu nò Ssé té záb ntʉ́m mǒ pie é ssé ye yɔɔn njÿó kéen ńjÿɔ́ʼ legye sɔ́b ńdɔg ńtɔʼɔ wɔ́b légyá kyɛ̀ʼ gie á fóo na nkʉ̀ mbòŋo, púʼu, pɔ́ té zsé páʼ shʉ́shÿɔ́g Keleto aa púʼu wɔ́. Yé Keleto aa páʼ Ssé gwɔ̌.
en: In their case, the god of this age   has blinded the minds of the unbelievers to keep them from seeing the light of the gospel of the glory of Christ,  # 4:4 Or the gospel of the glorious Christ, or the glorious gospel of Christ,# 4:4 Mk 10:37 who is the image of God.  # 4:4 Gn 1:27

ngiemboon: Peg te ne ńgwaa tsẅii nkʉ̀ mbòŋo, éfaʼa pɔ́ páʼ mé ge zsé wég wɔ́, peg faʼa pɔ́ páʼ mé ge zsé ngie Yěsô Keleto aa Cʉ̀apʉ̀a. Peg tyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ pafaʼa fàʼ pie é faʼa mbwó pi, ńtí Yěsô,
en: For we are not proclaiming ourselves but Jesus Christ as Lord,   and ourselves as your servants for Jesus’s sake.

ngiemboon: á nue Ssé gẅie à la gɔɔn ngie: «Á poŋ ngie akyɛ̀ʼ kyɛʼ nzěm,» yé lé twó yé, à kéen ńtó ńkyɛʼɛ tsɛ̀ɛ mentʉ́m még, légÿo peg zsé páʼ shʉ́shÿɔ́g we aa púʼu, á shʉ́shÿɔ́g gẅie mé ne ńgyá na shÿó Keleto.
en: For God who said, “Let light shine out of darkness,”   has shone in our hearts to give the light of the knowledge  # 4:6 Php 3:8; 1Jn 4:8 of God’s glory  # 4:6 Mk 10:37; Lk 9:32; Jn 17:24; 2Co 3:18; 2Pt 3:18 in the face of Jesus Christ.

ngiemboon: Tá peg pie yɔɔn fùʼ áa na peg, peg gwɔ̌ pɔ́ páʼ mengwʉ̌ŋ tsǎʼ la. Á fó mǒ, mé gyá mboŋó ngie mɛ̌ metʉ̀ mie efʉ̀ʼ ye te wó wɔ́, éfóo pɔ́ mbwó Ssé, é téen fóo mbwó peg wɔ́.
en: Now we have this treasure in clay jars, so that this extraordinary power   may be from God and not from us.

ngiemboon: Ngɔ́ʼ ne fóo meshÿó meshÿó ńtóo na peg, táʼ, ńké te ne ńgwɔʼɔ wég wɔ́. Á gʉa tsɔ́ fʉ̀ʼ, peg te gíŋ ńzsé páʼ peg ge gÿo wɔ́, táʼ, ńké te gɔɔn ngie anò zsoté wɔ́.
en: We are afflicted in every way but not crushed; we are perplexed but not in despair;

ngiemboon: Mé kʉ́e wég, e Ssé ké te wég gwáʼ. Ńteme wég ssé, táʼ, peg ké te kwé.
en: we are persecuted but not abandoned; we are struck down but not destroyed.

ngiemboon: Peg gwɔ́ fʉ̀ʼ ntsèm ńne ńzẅíŋe ngie peg ge kwé ntí legwé gẅie Yěsô la kwé wɛ̌, púʼu, légwɔ́ gie mé ge gyá ngie legwɔ́ we Yěsô aa yé soŋ nnɛ́ peg.
en: We always carry the death of Jesus   in our body, so that the life of Jesus may also be displayed in our body.

ngiemboon: Peg pie peg nyé wó, peg ee fʉ̀ʼ ntsèm ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ncwò legwé, ńtí nò Yěsô. Áa púʼu, légwɔ́ gie mé ge líe wég, é gyá ngie legwɔ́ we Yěsô, aa na mbùm yeg, tà mbɔɔ páʼ e ge gÿo kwé.
en: For we who live are always being given over to death   for Jesus’s sake, so that Jesus’s life may also be displayed in our mortal flesh.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ púʼu, legwé gwaa gwɔ́ soŋ nnɛ́ peg é ne faʼa yé fàʼ, legwɔ́ wó ne faʼa yé fàʼ soŋ nnɛ́ pi.
en: So then, death is at work in us, but life in you.

ngiemboon: Aŋwàʼne Ssé gɔɔn ngie: «N ka záb ntʉ́m na Ssé, áa mmó gie á ka gÿo n gɔɔn nò.» Peg ka lɔg páʼ peg záb ntʉ́m na Ssé na yɛ̌ ntí, ńgẅiin yég pɔ́ légɔɔn nò Ssé,
en: And since we have the same spirit of faith in keeping with what is written, I believed, therefore I spoke,   ,# 4:13 Ps 116:10 LXX we also believe, and therefore speak.

ngiemboon: ńne ńzsé ngie Ssé gie e la gÿo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô zíme na legwé, à ge gÿo gíŋ gÿo pege zím yégè, á nue pege la nnɛ́ na Yěsô. E Ssé gÿo pege metsèm kẅɛ, peg lâ Yěsô pú ńgwɔ́.
en: For we know that the one who raised the Lord Jesus will also raise us with Jesus   and present us with you.

ngiemboon: Peg zẅíŋe mɔɔn menò ntsèm mie Ssé ne ńgyá ngie é kuʼ még, ńdɔgɔ ńtsɔ́ɔn pɔ́ ngie pi zẅɛ́ʼ. Púʼu, ńzsé ngie nzẅìŋ pazsé ngie Ssé kwoŋo wɔ́b ge kẅiʼi gyɔ́ɔn, nzẅìŋ paná ndǎg mbwó yé, mbɔɔ paguʼte yé, é kẅiʼi ńgyɔ́ɔn.
en: Indeed, everything is for your benefit so that, as grace extends through more and more people, it may cause thanksgiving   to increase to the glory of God.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á gÿo peg te kʉ́a, mbùm nnɛ́ yeg tsa ńne ńkẅiʼi ńkʉ́a kʉ̌a táʼ, ntʉ́m wég gwɔ́ tsoló ńne éshumo shum lyɛ̌ʼ ntsèm.
en: Therefore we do not give up.   Even though our outer person is being destroyed, our inner person  # 4:16 Rm 7:22 is being renewed day by day.

ngiemboon: Acʉanò gie peg ee tsoló lɔɔn, á zeŋe zeŋe. Mé lɔɔn ḿbí fʉ̀ʼ, á le kuʼu tsɔ́ mmó na legúʼ tendège gẅie à těen ńdáʼa ḿmaga wɔ́, á gẅie yɛ̌ cʉanò lɔgɔ ńtsɔ́ʼɔ mánzsè ńnáa né pege wɔ́.
en: For our momentary light affliction   is producing for us an absolutely incomparable eternal weight of glory.  # 4:17 Lk 24:26; 1Pt 5:1,4

ngiemboon: Peg te ne faʼa pɔ́ mmó gie mé lɔg menÿɔ́g ńgyá wɔ́, peg ne faʼa pɔ́ gie mé té ne ńgyá lé nÿɔ́g wɔ́. Á zɔɔn ńgwaa gwɔ́, ammó gie mé lɔgɔ nÿɔ́g ńgyá, á té néŋe tɛʼ wɔ́, táʼ, à gie mé té lɔg nÿɔ́g ńgyá wɔ́, á téen ńdáʼa ḿmaga wɔ́.
en: So we do not focus on what is seen,   but on what is unseen. For what is seen is temporary, but what is unseen is eternal.
